Description: Fragment of heavy ring foot and floor of Attic black-glazed pottery fishplate; central depression fully preserved. Heavily abraded in places, especially stand surface and centre of underside. Mostly glazed save top of inside of foot and part of centre of underside; three fine added red lines on underside. Incised inscription on underside.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Area of Site 21 (Hogarth) and Site 32 (Hogarth) [Hogarth et al. 1898-9, 33]
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 50)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 699, no. 572)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1913)
